caption:
The photo presents a vibrant maritime scene, set against a historical backdrop that suggests a coastal town, possibly in the Mediterranean. In the foreground, a large vessel labeled "VILA VELEBITA PULA" is moored at a quayside. The ship, painted in black and white, features a sturdy hull and a deck cluttered with equipment, including ropes and cranes, indicative of a working boat, potentially involved in cargo or industrial activities.

Several individuals are visible on the ship, engaged in various tasks; two men appear to be handling equipment while another observes, collaboratively suggesting an ongoing maritime operation.

The background contrasts the industrial foreground with a serene historic town view. Prominent in the backdrop is a tall, slender bell tower, characteristic of Mediterranean architecture, likely dating from a significant historical period given its design and patination. The tower stands out against a clear sky, overlooking terracotta-roofed buildings that cascade down towards the water, hinting at a densely built, old European town.

Overall, the composition juxtaposes the industrial aspects of maritime life with the enduring charm of historical architecture, captured under bright, clear weather conditions, contributing to a lively yet picturesque scene.
title: The Vila Velebite II, the hydrobiological research ship of the Ruđer Bošković Institute, conducts several scientific projects for EPA.
